decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the approved plans - 791_44-46pln_001 Rev C, 791_44-46pln_002 Rev C, 791_44-46pln_003 Rev B

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the building hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details of application ref: PP/2013/0342 dated 01.05.2013.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies D3 & D4 of the London Plan (2016) and Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2013). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E and F of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no works or development shall be carried out.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7A, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies D3, D4, D6 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021). | The refuse and recycling store shown on the approved drawing 791_44-46pln_002 Rev C shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the dwelling and thereafter retained.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies D4 and SI8 of the London Plan (2021). | The Arboricultural report and method statement shall be in accordance with the approved details of application ref: PP/2013/0793 dated 01/05/2013. The development shall thereafter be carried out only in accordance with the approved method statement which shall apply until the end of the construction period.

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with policies G7 and SI1 of the London Plan, policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines. | Details of the approved obscure glazing to be used in, and means of fixing shut, the window in the first floor en-suite shall be in accordance with the approved details of application ref: PP/2013/0446 dated 11.06.2013 and thereafter retained.

Reason: To minimise overlooking and interference with the privacy of adjoining occupiers and in the interests of good neighbourliness and in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall be Conservation Grade, shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To minimise light spillage and interference with the privacy and outlook of adjoining occupiers and in the interests of good neighbourliness and in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, a demolition method statement/ construction management plan shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing. Details shall include control measures for:-
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays and 0800 -1300 Saturdays (except no work on public holidays),
- neighbour liaison, notifications to interested parties and
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 & 2.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies D6, D10, D14, T3, T4 and T7 of the London Plan 2021, the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise
description: Application for a Minor Material Amendment (S73A) to vary condition 2 (approved plans) of planning permission Ref: PP/2011/4954 (APP/A5270/A/12/2176376) dated 15.10.2012 (as varied by Ref: 213872VAR dated 29.07.2021) for 'Construction of a detached two storey 2-bedroom house with on-site car parking, refuse and recycling storage area and associated landscaping (following demolition of existing structures). Amendment seeks minor enlargement of dwelling to rear at ground and first floor levels'
